math3d

Class Vector3

  • java.lang.Object
    • math3d.Vector3

  • public class Vector3
extends java.lang.Object
    A 3-dimensional vector.

        public Vector3(double x,
               double y,

        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        z - the z coordinate

      • Vector3

        public Vector3(double n)
        Create a new Vector2 with all of the coordinates equal
        Parameters:
        n - the value of the x, y, and z coordinates

      • Vector3

        public Vector3(double[] a)
        Create a vector from an array. x should be at index 0, y at index 1, and z at index 2.
        Parameters:
        a - the array of coordinates

      • toGlArray

        public double[] toGlArray()
        Special version of toArray() for OpenGL. The x, y and z values are rearranged.
        Returns:
        an array representation of this vector, in the order y, z, x

      • normal

        public static Direction3 normal(Vector3 v1,
                                Vector3 v2,
                                Vector3 v3)
        Computes the normal vector of a triangle, with vertices in counter- clockwise order. Use .inverse() on the output of this function to find the opposite normal, assuming vertices are clockwise.
        Parameters:
        v1 - point 1
        v2 - point 2
        v3 - point 3
        Returns:
        the normal Direction3

      • lerp

        public Vector3 lerp(Vector3 v,
                    double amount)
        Linear interpolation between this vector and another
        Parameters:
        v - the other vector
        amount - amount to move between vectors. 0 returns this vector. 1 returns the other vector. 0.5 returns the halfway point. Somewhere in between returns a vector in between the two.
        Returns:
        a new vector between this vector and another

      • magnitude

        public double magnitude()
        Get the magnitude or length of a vector
        Returns:
        the magnitude of the vector

      • magnitudeSquare

        public double magnitudeSquare()
        Get the square of the magnitude of a vector. This is a faster calculation, and is useful when the actual values don't matter.
        Returns:
        the squared magnitude of the vector

      • setMagnitude

        public Vector3 setMagnitude(double magnitude)
        Return a new vector with the same direction and a different magnitude
        Parameters:
        magnitude - the magnitude to set
        Returns:
        a new vector with the specified magnitude

      • limitMagnitude

        public Vector3 limitMagnitude(double max)
        If the magnitude is greater than max, return a new vector with max as the magnitude. Otherwise, return this vector
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum magnitude
        Returns:
        a vector with its magnitude limited

      • normalize

        public Vector3 normalize()
        Return a new, "unit vector" with the same direction and a magnitude of 1.
        Returns:
        a unit vector
